lead_paragraph: The broader reach of regulations, intended to keep companies from cutting deals to move income overseas, appears to have caught many by surprise.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED and LESLIE PICKER

headline.print_headline: Pfizer and Allergan Said to End Merger as Tax Rules Tighten
headline.main: Pfizer and Allergan Are Said to End Merger as Tax Rules Tighten

snippet: The broader reach of regulations, intended to keep companies from cutting deals to move income overseas, appears to have caught many by surprise.
abstract: Pfizer is planning to ditch plans for $152 billion merger with Allergan, reportedly due to new tax rules introduced by Obama admin as part of efforts to prevent companies from moving income overseas to lessen tax liability.
